name: Union Negotiation - Labor Agreement
content: James negotiating new three-year labor agreement with union representatives Robert and Maria. Initial proposal: 4% annual wage increases met resistance due to regional competitors offering 5-6%. James emphasized superior benefits package (health, pension, training) as differentiator. Attempted compromise: 4.5% raises with Sunday overtime cap rejected as breaking 20-year standard. James cited non-union competition pressuring bid competitiveness. Breakthrough proposal: 4.25% wage increases with preserved Sunday double-time premium plus innovative 2% profit-sharing pool distributed by hours worked. Union receptive to alignment incentive structure. James committed to quarterly third-party audited financial transparency. Negotiations progressing toward potential agreement with executive committee review pending. Strategic negotiation balancing cost control, worker retention, and competitive positioning.
summary: Union negotiation: compromised at 4.25% raises plus profit-sharing, maintained Sunday premium, committed to financial transparency
background_sounds: quiet meeting room, occasional paper shuffling, coffee cups
